page.title: 16THE VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: The school, opened in 1964,replacing the village hall,stands in the centre of the village with a picturesque view of farmland to the south.It has its own gardens,playing field,adventure play area and playground marked out to provide many games and activities. Insidethe building are two classrooms with sliding doors opening on to an assembly hall. Attendance at the school has declined from about 60 infants and juniors in 1979 to only 28 in 1985,mainly due to a decrease in the birthrate.The children come from a wide catchment area which includes the forest,the village and outlying farms.Many are brought in by mini-bus or cars.Most of the children stay for school meals brought in from a central kitchen,or have packed lunch.
